attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for child rape
attributes.background: A child who is raped has the rest of their life to face in ruins and turmoil due to what has happend to them. So why do we have such light sentences for it. With this crime increasing daily it should now have the sentence of life in prison to help prevent this awful act.

attributes.action: Advise the Queen to make London Borough of Richmond a Royal Borough
attributes.background: Richmond has two existing Royal Palaces (Hampton Court & Kew Palace) and a rich history of Royal connections, patronage and places. No borough deserves Royal status more than Richmond.
attributes.additional_details: I wrote to the Secretary of State a few years ago asking for Royal Borough status for Richmond and it was politely declined in favour of Greenwich. Time to ask again via this petition.

attributes.action: Subsidise Care Fees for the elderly by using money from  Overseas Aid.
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to sell their homes to fund their care when billions are spent, much of it wasted, on foreign aid.  Surely we should look after our own first, before borrowing money to spend on foreigners.

attributes.action: SUSPEND THE £118,000,000.00 GIVEN BY UK TO BURMA THIS YEAR INDEFINITELY
attributes.background:
Britain must save money,especially before uncertain times like BREXIT, when ID CHECKS at hospitals are proposed,the question is,why's BURMA set to receive £118 million from the British taxpayer
when clearly committing crimes against humanity,
and addressing it is the responsibility of all humanity
attributes.additional_details:
PM meeting with Burmese State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi: 13/09/16 -Downing Street spokesperson said: "The Prime Minister said we stood ready to provide further assistance as Burma continues to develop, including through £118 million in support this year."

Yale study suggested that the abuse of the more than one million Rohingya may amount to genocide;a confidential United Nations report to the Security Council says it may constitute “crimes against humanity under international criminal law.”

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL.
attributes.background: Communication  in children is very important. But what happens when the only way to communicate is by sign? Not being able to communicate and make friends can lower a child's self-esteem.Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL in schools.

attributes.action: Impose economic sanctions on the USA if they renege on the Paris Climate deal
attributes.background: Climate change is an immediate threat to global ecosystems, livelihoods and communities. The Paris climate agreement is international law and must be fulfilled in order to mitigate dangerous warming. We call for economic sanctions on the USA if they withdraw from the agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change will rapidly escalate within decades unless urgent action is taken. The USA contribute 16% of global CO2 emissions and must play a leading role in fulfilling the Paris agreement. If the USA withdraw this could lead to catastrophic consequences, with the poorest people in the world suffering the most. If they withdraw, the UK should impose economic sanctions on the USA and encourage its allies to do likewise. 
www.newscientist.com/article/2112164-president-trump-means-we-cant-escape-a-dangerously-warmer-world/ www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition 
www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Make health warnings compulsory on processed meat.
attributes.background: Since the world health authority classified processed meat as class one carcinogen to humans. (Definitely causes cancer.) There should be health warnings placed on all packaging, in the same way the warnings have to be on cigarettes.
attributes.additional_details: Class 1 carcinogen = definitely causes cancer in humans as classified by WHO.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all businesses to hold a defibrillator on site.
attributes.background: Defibrillators save lives. If someone has a cardiac arrest time is everything. Having tools available to hand can give people a chance of survival.I lost my mum to cardiac arrest while she was at work & there was no difibrillator on site even though she worked in a large scale government building.
attributes.additional_details: A defibrillator is a device that gives a high energy electric shock to the heart through the chest wall to someone who is in cardiac arrest.

attributes.action: Make schools relax their uniform policies
attributes.background: Schools are turning pupils away due to uniform violations which disrupts a child's education. Schools should be made to relax these draconian policies. A parent is fined for taking their child out in term time, yet schools openly send children home. Clothing does not have a bearing on education!
attributes.additional_details:
Why do schools think it's ok to disrupt a child's education in this way? This denies children the education they are entitled to. The strict uniform policies are often discriminatory and unfair, if not petty.
School uniforms are a part of school life, this is accepted, but why does the 'wrong colour' black shoe or wrong type of material matter?  A child's education should matter more than the cut of their clothing. Make schools relax their policies to ensure all children are treated fairly!

attributes.action: Abolish old & outdated leasehold law for all leasehold flats. Make them freehold
attributes.background: Crooked & unregulated freeholders hold leaseholders to ransom with high fees. When we buy a flat, we should also own a section of the outside part of the building and parts of the communal area. Responsibility should lie with the flat owner, not the freeholder. Commonhold law may be required here.
attributes.additional_details: The freeholder of the building should be forced to sell part of their freehold (for a cheap price) at the start and then eventually force them to give up the freehold. Leaseholders in UK are being conned and ripped off by unregulated freeholders.

attributes.action: The UK Government to ask the Nigerian Govt to end sexual abuse of victims of BH
attributes.background:
https://www.naij.com/1065882-how-nigerian-officials-sexually-abuse-and-steal-from-boko-haram-victims.html
Please help me and Bayo Olupohunda @BayoOlupohunda highlight the plight of these forgotten women and children.
attributes.additional_details: There are around 5,000 women and children in Internal Displacement Camps in Nigeria, they have been raped by Boko Haram terrorists and have either escaped or been released and have ended up in the IDP camps, the stigma of having been taken by BH means that many of them can't return to their homes. Corrupt officials in the camps are diverting food and medical supplies and are raping the women and girls too. Haven't these women and girls suffered enough?

attributes.action: Debate Autism and Employment
attributes.background: As somebody on the Autism Spectrum I currently claim Jobseeker's Allowance and I feel that I have not been given any support to look for a job and they don't understand Autism or how to help people like me to get into employment.
attributes.additional_details: There needs to be people trained in Autism within the DWP as the advisors I have seen do not seem to understand people like me at all, this leads to me feeling very emotional and stressed out, and I dread attending the jobcentre as I really dislike being there, you literally get 5 minutes to be seen then your out the door.

attributes.action: Make political education a compulsory lesson in schools
attributes.background: I am an 18 year old who has been shocked with the political results in 2016. Many have complained that recent referendum and election results are due to uneducated voters. Politics affects everyone, so why is it that not everyone understands or it taught about it?
attributes.additional_details: Not once in my education have I ever had a politics lesson. Even though I didn't choose to study this subject at a level, I am interested in it and feel it is vital that every student has a basic understanding of it. By scheduling compulsory political lessons for everyone you are telling young people that it matters and that their vote matters. Lack of education leads people to make uninformed choices that can have a huge effect on the end result. Let's end uneducated votes.

attributes.action:
Provide CCTV in all Care homes (
Special Needs, Disabled, Dementia, Elderly)
attributes.background: I am a single mum with a son who has autism and should he live in a care home, when i am no longer around, I want him to be protected and all his care to be recorded in case of negligence or abuse.

attributes.action: UK residents without right to vote in general elections to be income tax exempt
attributes.background: No taxation without representation. There are millions of people living, working, and paying taxes in the UK, but with no right to participate to national politics with their vote. Parliament and Government do not represent them, and should not dispose of the tax revenues raised through their work.
attributes.additional_details:
The numbers say that foreigners positively contribute to the UK revenue. The last Governments have pursued austerity policies, and have not invested this additional income to fund health, education, and housing systems. Instead, foreigners are have been blamed to put pressure on these systems.
The Government is not accountable to foreigners because they have no right to vote. This is against the spirit of John Hampden, English great patriot, who first claimed "no taxation without representation"

attributes.action: End industrial breeding of domestic pets to protect the welfare of  animals.
attributes.background:
The Australian Government has just introduced new legislation into Parliament. Their Domestic Animals Act protects the welfare of breeding animals to ensure that their pets come from good homes.
By overhauling the Animal Welfare Act 2006, we in the UK can reform breeding and pet shop industries.
attributes.additional_details:
• Reduce the number of fertile female dogs a breeder can keep.

• Crack down on backyard breeders, so they will have to register with their council as a Domestic Animal Business.

• Establish a Registry of these businesses, giving councils the information to determine who is eligible to register as a breeder and better police the new laws.

• Pet shops will no longer be able to sell puppies and kittens unless they have come from a registered breeder, foster home, animal shelter or charity.

• Foster Carers who look after pets waiting for new homes will have clearer rights and responsibilities – caring for animals without having to register as a Domestic Animal Business, but with the benefit from reduced council registration fees.

attributes.action: Make the time of paternity leave longer than 2 weeks
attributes.background: 2 weeks is not enough time for a father to bond with their child. In those first weeks skin to skin is so important to establish a bond between parent and child. It also is good to have helping hands after a mother has given birth (including after major surgery).
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.economist.com/blogs/economist-explains/2015/05/economist-explains-18

http://national.deseretnews.com/article/2143/10-reasons-dads-should-take-paternity-leave.html

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC Television Licence.
attributes.background: The BBC licence fee is a unlawful tax against watching television. The BBC should not dictate our ability to watch television such as ITV and Channel 4.

attributes.action: Urge the Norwegian Government to end the culling of wild wolves
attributes.background: Norway has announced that it plans to allow hunters to kill 47 wolves living in the wild, despite the species being listed as "critically endangered" on the 2015 Norwegian list of endangered animals. This represents the cull of up to two-thirds of the country's total wild wolf population.
attributes.additional_details:
- Rovdata recorded a wolf population of between 65-68 in winter 2015-2016.
- Nina Jensen, the head of the Norwegian branch of the WWF has called the plans "outright mass slaughter".
- Illustrative datapoint: a 2010 study by the U.S. Department of Agriculture showed that out of 1.7 million cattle deaths that year, only 2.3 percent were caused by predators (of which many are attributed to dogs and other predator species).
- The UK considers itself as a leader in animal welfare standards.

attributes.action: stop charging staff and service users parking at Southmead hospital in Bristol.
attributes.background: Currently cost a full time worker £300 minimum  a year for a parking permit yet there is not enough spaces. Service users are also charged for Parking.

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: In 2012 the Coalition Government raised tuition fees to £9000 a year, which means students now face crippling debt. This shackling debt often lasts decades. Free education is a right not a privilege. We have to act now to take back what's rightfully ours!
attributes.additional_details: Young students eager to better themselves as people are facing crippling debt after they leave university unless they are born of a very wealthy family. This ensures that the wealth stays with the families who have always had it. Worse still is the number of young people denied the chance of university due to their disadvantaged background. Free education is vital if we are to have a country that utilises the most talented rather than the most fortunate. Free education is necessary for equality.

attributes.action: Government to pay NHS £5bn Brexit bonus from 2019/20 and every year thereafter.
attributes.background: Now that MP's have voted to trigger Article 50 the Government should stick to the promises made during the Brexit campaign.  Although the well publicised figure of £350m per week isn't realistic I would like to see them pledge a Brexit bonus of £5bn for 2019/20 and every year thereafter.

attributes.action: Make buyers committed to the purchase of a property after making an offer
attributes.background: Many people have had an offer on their house withdrawn just prior to the exchange of contracts. This has resulted in them losing the house which they wish to purchase but still incurring solicitors/search fees. The law should be changed to protect the seller in the same way that it is in Scotland
attributes.additional_details: The offer on our house was withdrawn the day before exchange of contracts was due to take place. We had made an offer on another property, had searches done and were ready to exchange at the same time (back to back sale/purchase). When our sale fell through this house went back on the market and sold to another buyer leaving us with almost £2000 solicitor fees still to pay.

attributes.action: Establish a Financial Services Tribunal to resolve customer disputes.
attributes.background: Major banks and other financial services institutions are often in dispute with customers who deserve protection. Access to court is costly. The FOS ombudsman scheme is inadequate. The FCA is not equipped to resolve disputes. Tribunals offer scrutiny, justice and censure which deters misconduct.

attributes.action: Repeal ALL anti-smoking legislation.
attributes.background: Smoking tobacco is a legal past time, the Government has no legitimate right to restrict a legal activity.  The covering up of cigarettes in shops is ridiculous and counter productive.  Plain packaging does not work.  The high taxation is counter productive and encourages smuggling.

attributes.action: Guarantee PIP for all people diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: If you are officially diagnosed with ASD/Autism by a GP or a health care professional such as a psychologist, psychiatrist or a multidisciplinary team, then a PIP assessment to prove your illness should not be needed. It should be recognised upon application when you provide written diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details: ASD/Autism is a life long condition and should automatically qualify for PIP. The assessment is nothing more than unnecessary bureaucracy that usually ends in refusal for PIP. I would also like to make the RT Hon Damian Green MP aware that the assessors that carry out these assessments do take advantage of an autistic person's disability to ensure they dont score any points in the assessment and refuse them PIP. If the RT Hon Damian Green would like more detail I am available to talk about it.

attributes.action: Implement a 12 month ban for using mobiles while driving.
attributes.background: Far too many people are still ignoring the fact that people are being injured and killed daily due to mobile phone distraction behind the wheel. If you get caught driving and using your phone you should face the same punishment as drink drivers and be banned from driving for 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 500,000 drivers still using mobile phones at wheel, study shows
At least one in 20 drivers aged under 30 have been caught flouting the law 
Report said using hand-held device is more dangerous than drink or drugs
In 2013, mobile phone use behind the wheel was factor in 22 fatal collisions


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/

attributes.action: Don't allow Abu Hamza back in the country to serve his prison sentence
attributes.background:
Abu Hamza is currently serving a jail sentence in America.  For many years, this preacher of hate was allowed to spout his vile and repugnant views. 
We believe that he should not be allowed back in the country to serve his sentence and should serve it in the US.

attributes.action: Recommission Britannia and give the Queen her boat back - she's earned it!
attributes.background: The Queen has been selfless in her work for this country and the Commonwealth. We took one her great loves away from her and its about time Great Britain and the Commonwealth gave her something back.
attributes.additional_details: This would also benefit Great Britain in its pursuit of international trade deals following its exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory dog licences. Making it offence to own a dog without one.
attributes.background:
Unfortunately back in 1987 when policing  issues were harder this law was Abolished. 
With modern laws and regulations a new licence can be enforced. 
This will aid in the reduction of Back Yard Breeding and the ever increasing over population of stray dogs in rescue centres accross the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Most countries still have licences. 
Having one makes the owner accountable for its dogs actions. 
If your dog goes missing the chances of getting it back are greater. 
No puppy can be bought without a licence including their vaccination details. 
Greater fines for owners without a licence.
DNA records would be held for prosecution and identification purposes. 
Breeders can only sell dogs with a recognised licence and permit.
Service dogs would be free. 
Elderly concession rates.

attributes.action: For the NHS to fund mTOR inhibitor and for free.
attributes.background: It will help those with TSC, will help with the facial rash that develops during the course of childhood, and will clear the rash up that is caused by TSC.
attributes.additional_details: Letters from NHS,Queen,Prime minister, and department of health.

attributes.action: simplify Rights of Way legislation so the network can be made fit for modern use
attributes.background:
Our historic Rights of Way network is no longer fit for purpose, the legislation is complex making changes or diversions time consuming and prohibitively expensive.

Changes are needed to prevent users coming in to conflict with livestock, households, business premises and farm machinery.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there are several incidents of Rights of Way users being severely injured or killed by livestock, equally there are many incidents of livestock being harmed, when a simple re-alignment or diversion would be beneficial to all parties.

Similarly many ancient paths are routed through domestic, farm and business premises creating safety and security issues for both users and occupiers.

The petition is not to impinge on the rights of users but to make the network fit for modern usage.

attributes.action: PLEASE GIVE RIGHT OF APPEAL TO TIER 1 ENTREPRENEUR INITIAL & EXTENSION VISA
attributes.background: Our request to all Honourable UK Parliament members is that please restore the right of appeal for Tier 1 entrepreneur applicants if refused due to errors, Appeal right defend the applicants and allow them to provide solid evidence against the raised issues
attributes.additional_details: Applicants can apply for an administrative review of the Tier 1 entrepreneur refusal decision if they think that Home Office has made an error in considering their application.When they apply for administrative review, no evidence is allowed to forward in favour of the refused application. This means that if Home Office maintained the refused decision then they order applicants to leave the country ASAP and they could lose their running business and investment that could ruin their future

attributes.action: protect workers on universal credit by having their 'housing element' protected.
attributes.background: unfair sanctions mean part time workers lose their 'standard' allowance, (money to live on), and THEN have their wages deducted from their rent element aswell. So they have no money to pay bills/bank charges, no money to buy food but also no money to cover all their rent and face becoming homeless.
attributes.additional_details: I have been sanctioned my personal element of £317.82 for 63 days (for missing one appointment) which means the element to buy food and pay bills has gone, then because I work part time my wages are then deducted from my housing element ALSO. This is only going to lead to homelessness and severe hardship and debt. The person affected can not claim back bank charges from unpaid direct debits so they are in debt/arrears and face being homeless EVEN if this sanction is later overturned.

attributes.action: Licence and regulate nail technicians, hairdressers and beauticians.
attributes.background: People in the hair and beauty industry are not always qualified or have only done 1 day of training which isnt enough, these uneducated people are working on the public with no knowlage and insurance. They are also causing harm and damage to the public aswell as illegal workers being exploited.
attributes.additional_details: Not being educated in this industry, working on the public and having illness, disabilities, young children and exploitation of illegal workers could cause serious harm to people. Also the people who are working without the correct qualification IS NOT able to obtain any form of insurance meaning they are not covered incase of accident or damage.

attributes.action: Force Local Authorities to allocate a proportion of housing to pet owners.
attributes.background: People are being forced to make the decision between giving up their pets or being homeless.  For some people their pet is the only family they have, and the animal is often vital for helping with mental health issues. People end up living on the streets rather than giving up their beloved friend.
attributes.additional_details: In every town in Britain there are people living on the streets, for no other reason than their local authority is refusing to home them. They are given the impossible choice of giving up their pet or being homeless. They are vulnerable people, and are being discriminated against for sharing love and companionship with a pet. It would be detrimental for them to lose their pets, and would put additional strain on the mental health service. They are at risk of serious harm or death on the street.

attributes.action: Table a UN Security Council resolution on Daesh to end impunity for genocide
attributes.background:
HMG must take decisive steps to: 
1. table a UN SC resolution establishing a commission of experts on genocide and then establishing an ad hoc tribunal; or 
2. table a UN SC resolution referring the situation in Syria and Iraq (as caused by Daesh since 2014) to the International Criminal Court.
attributes.additional_details: Daesh is responsible for genocidal atrocities on minorities, including Christians, Yazidis, and other religious minorities, in the Middle East and beyond. This genocide was recognized by the European Parliament, the Council of Europe, and the US, Australian, and Canadian governments. In April 2016, the House of Commons called upon HMG to take the lead at the UN SC. This steps has not been taken yet and is urgently needed to end impunity and to ensure that justice is served.

attributes.action: Gelatine in our food must be marked what animal it is from and in bold writing.
attributes.background: Gelatine is in our food, sweets, pharmaceutical products and many other products. If a product contains Gelatine, it must be written what animal it is from and it must be in bold writing. Food products that contain Gelatine must be clearly marked in bold writing Not suitable for vegetarians.

attributes.action: ban the use of prong and shock collars for dogs within the UK.
attributes.background: Prong and shock collars can cause psychological and physical harm to dogs even when correctly used and can even precipitate aggression in the animal. At present there is no legislation restricting their use and anyone can apply them to any dog.
attributes.additional_details: Many so called trainers many with few or no qualifications use them and get obedience because the dog is terrified of the pain and distress caused rather than because it has been well trained. Alternative methods are effective  see site https://positively.com/dog-training/methods-equipment/training-equipment/choke-and-prong-collars/ for details of the injuries caused by these devices

attributes.action: Stop paying non uk citizens any benifits
attributes.background: If we stop paying benifits. Some migrants will leave of there own accord. Some might stop trying to come to the UK

attributes.action: Make basic paediatric first aid/cpr part of antenatal care
attributes.background: Many babies/young children could be saved if new parents were given guidance on simple cpr and first aid in relation to babies and young children. Early Years Professionals and healthcare professionals receive training, however, parents (who are with their children the majority of the time) do not.

attributes.action: Make profiting from lying about a military career a criminal offence
attributes.background:
No military or civilian person should be able to make financial gains from lying about or exaggerating military service.

Including but not limited to being paid as an after-dinner speaker (to discuss their military service) or receiving royalties from so-called 'real life event' style book sales.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently several individuals in the public eye who are making a healthy profit by selling books and after-dinner speeches about their so-called military service.

Unless able to be verified (possible by a number of simple checks), they should be prosecuted, & any wrongful financial gain donated to a relevant military charity or similar organisation (for example the Royal British Legion).

attributes.action: Call for a second EU referendum due to misleading campaign lies in the first.
attributes.background: Lies made informed choices less likely. Unlike exaggeration & forecasts (where some variability may be inherent) lies have no factual basis. Among many, 2 prominent were: £350 million/wk paid to EU – to go to the NHS; & Turkey on the cusp of EU admission. Genuine & thorough campaign info was scarce.
attributes.additional_details: An independent body should regulate campaign information (as in commerce, where lies are justifiably banned). Democracy can't exist if voters can't judge the options, & as campaigns may be biased their protest to lies is inadequate. Additional reasons for a 2nd, honest referendum are: no mandate for Brexit's form; nearly half-in-half results; possible UK break-up; many years of negotiation likely; renegotiation of all current world trade deals; less EU trade access; & EU rules we have no say in.

attributes.action: Ban FRACKING in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Fracking leads to devastating consequences for the environment. 
It contaminates groundwater with the use of toxic chemicals, contaminates the land, can cause earthquakes!
attributes.additional_details: Science!!!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to produce and use products made of non-recyclable plastic
attributes.background: We need to stop thinking that plastic waste is being dealt with to the degree at which it is advertised. We do not need non-recyclable plastic, and this is evident by the amount we only use once - then throw away every day.
attributes.additional_details: A large amount of plastics marked 'recyclable' are not recycled in the UK (mostly mixed plastics) and are instead sent abroad to be disposed of. As a result of this, we need to open far more facilities capable of processing and recycling mixed plastics. Our use of non-recyclable plastic is unsustainable, irresponsible and unnecessary.

attributes.action: The government to help victims of domestic violence
attributes.background: social services need further training with dealing with women of domestic violence they are quick enough to take children away from women but they are not trained to support women in getting out of these relationship or helping women to be reunited with their children
attributes.additional_details: All cases involving social services and courts should have a expert witness available to explain to everyone the effects and complications of domestically violent relationships also to help everyone understand it. Too many women are just deemed as bad mothers for not being able to escape domestically abusive relationship when there is no support even from social services

attributes.action: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to even out traffic flow.
attributes.background: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to limit the amount of traffic going into the tunnel or on the bridge at once. This could help to reduce accidents also.
attributes.additional_details: The fines are not being spent well enough if they have to be in place! Use this money to help improve our traffic flow!

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for employees to be paid double on a Sunday
attributes.background: Many people including myself are required to work most, if not every Sunday, without any additional pay. Considering Sunday hasn't always been a legal trading day and the act was only put in place in 1994, I think it should be a legal requirement that all employees should be paid double on a Sunday.

attributes.action: Put a stop to Annualised/Banked Hours contracts in workplaces.
attributes.background: The government needs to abolish the Banked/Annualised Hours contracts in workplaces. Employees are working over the working time directive, where the additional overtime is banked. This should be paid at a normal or premium rate as standard.
attributes.additional_details: Employees who work under this scheme have to constantly monitor hours that are either "Banked" or "Owed". Sometimes working unsociable hours, or days where the employer will then tactically either stand down employee from shift to ensure further hours are not "Banked", or put unreasonable requests to employees to make up hours "owed".

attributes.action: Abolish the High Income Child Benefit Tax Charge
attributes.background:
Abolish the Government's high income child benefit tax charge for an individual income exceeding £50,000 introduced in January 2013. 

This tax charge effects families when a individual parent income exceeds the threshold.  This tax charge means they are no longer eligible for full child benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many instances where an individual parent income is the only source of income for an entire family.  

This tax charge isn't proportionate or fair when compared to a joint couple who's combined income can potentially reach £100,000 and not be subject to any child benefit tax charge. 

This tax charge needs to be abolished it's horrendously unfair and discriminates against many families.  A tax system should be fair across the board, this certainly isn't.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/comment/9788481/Abolish-child-benefit-and-give-families-a-tax-break.html
